channel.title: Mac on Brandontreb
channel.description: Recent content in Mac on Brandontreb

item.title: Creating A Twitter Client For OSX – Part 1
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: With the upcoming release of the Mac App Store, I can only imagine another gold rush is upon us. Clever Indie developers making money hand over fist while the store as well as developers find their identities. With that being said, I feel that there is a serious lack of interesting (maintained) Twitter clients for OSX. I say “maintained” because Tweetie for OSX is just fantastic, however Twitter said they don’t have any plans for it at this time.

item.title: Core Data QuickTip: Inverse Relationships
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: One thing I always wondered about Core Data is why the compiler would warn you if you didn’t specify the inverse relationship. After reading through Apple’s docs, they essentially say its to make your database more robust by reinforcing those relationships. Plus, you never know when you may have one thing and need to get to the other. After working on a project with an Enormous Core Data database, I found one very useful thing about inverses.

item.title: XCode Shortcut
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: When in XCode on a MacBook Pro, doing a 3-finger swipe up will switch between the .h and .m files. ⌘-option-up will do the same thing Productivity++

item.title: Creating A Twitter Client In Objective-C Client Part 2
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: This tutorial has moved! I have updated it to support Twitter’s Oauth, you can find the first tutorial in there series by clicking the link below Creating A Twitter Client For OSX – Part 1 This is part 2 in our series about creating a Twitter client in Objective-C. In case you missed it, here is a link to part 1 of this series. In the last tutorial I showed you how to retrieve data from Twitter and display the XML in the Console.
